model

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    A grid of a binary puzzle it contains a list of cells representing the current state. It has the ability to manage and keep track of the current state using commands implemented using the Command Design Pattern.
    Since:
    Sunday February 24

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Grid()
      Default constructor for a grid, initializes up variables

        public void applyAction(Command a,
               boolean stored)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Applies a certain action.
        Parameters:
        a - The action to be applied
        stored - Whether the action should be saved for undo/redoing
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If pre-condition is violated ||
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - When the action throws an exception.
        Precondition:
        a != null

        Throws:

      • setCell

        public void setCell(int col,
           int row,
           CellValue newValue)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a cell at certain coordinate.
        Parameters:
        col - the col of the cell on the puzzle (or x coordinate)
        row - the row of the cell on the puzzle (or y coordinate)
        newValue - The new value of the cell at the coordinates
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If pre-condition is violated.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the cell is locked
        Precondition:
        0 <= col < width && 0 <= row < height && newValue != null
